### Track all execution events posted from StackPulse playbooks in one dashboard.

### Use tags on events to separate events by environments, services and applications and build out different dashboards. 

###For full visibility into your StackPulse playbooks executions got to [the StackPulse app](https//app.stackpulse.com)

definition.content:
### About StackPulse

[StackPulse](https://stackpulse.com) keeps software services reliable, from alert to resolution. Intuitive incident response and powerful playbook orchestration help you automate your incident process to mitigate and remediate faster.

### Using this dashboard

In the dashboard you can track StackPulse originated events though a timeline and event stream. These events are produced by the [Datadog Post Event step](https://github.com/stackpulse/steps/tree/master/steps/datadog/post-event) in StackPulse playbooks running in the [StackPulse App](https://app.stackpulse.com). 

You can use these events to keep track of playbook executions, send back status updates or even share enriched data collected by your playbooks back to Datadog.
